channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10225] Bug in calls to RegionObsever.postScannerFilterRow
item.description:
Just noticed that while looking at HBASE-10047.
In 0.94 (and presumably in trunk, will check later) we have this:


    protected boolean nextRow(byte [] currentRow, int offset, short length) throws IOException {

     ...

      if (this.region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {

        return this.region.getCoprocessorHost().postScannerFilterRow(this, currentRow);

      }

      return true;

    }

Notice how we only pass currentRow into the coprocessor, but not offset and length. Anything using this hook currently is 100% broken. The hook was added in 0.94.5 (HBASE-5664), it never worked correctly.

Anoop Sam John, you had added the hook. Do you still need it?

We can either remove it (I'd prefer that in the light of the performance issued observed in HBASE-10047, we can leave the stub in BaseRegionObserver in 0.94, but document that it is no-op), or we'd have to have change its signature to be able to pass offset and length as well.

Since nobody noticed nobody is using this hook currently, so both should be valid options.

(Making a new standalone copy of the rowkey just to pass into this method absolutely out of the question for performance reasons).

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: stack, Andrew Purtell, any comments for 0.96 and 0.98?

It is still used by HIndex. Correct rajeshbabu?
We never needed the current row and was not using that at all. So not noticed this issue.
+1 for correcting this in all versions.

This will be called when the filter filters out the row. So your test is like filtering out most of the rows Lars?
I can give a simple quick patch..

Yes Anoop, the hook has used in HIndex and the current row is not used.
Its better to correct.
Fix with changing the CP hook signature.
Lars Hofhansl If you okey with current patch, I can give patch for 94 branch also now.

Wow. You guys are fast, I was just about to post a patch for the same.

This will be called when the filter filters out the row. So your test is like filtering out most of the rows Lars?

Exactly. The scenario under which this is an issue is not common though (most rows filters and very tall tables).

+1 on patch for trunk and 0.98.

For 0.94, 0.96 should we keep the old method in BaseRegionObserver, and just not call it, for (perhaps?) better binary compatibility? stack?

I would vote for maintaining this with correcting the signature in 94 and 96. As you said I firmly belive no one else using this. Else this could have come up time back. Any way waiting for stack's call on this.

Here's a 0.94 patch.
(HadoopQA has already started).

I tried a patched 0.94 HBase with an old Phoenix jar and client, works fine.

I agree this should be fixed or removed. The risk of this causing issues is low. A worry was coprocessor jars somehow shipping a copy of the BaseRegionObserver, but since Phoenix still works fine - and there probably isn't a more heavy user of coprocessors ATM, I'm +1 on 0.94 for this.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12620138/10225-0.94.txt
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12620138

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8264//console

This message is automatically generated.
I am +1 on correcting the signature. Patch lgtm.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Leaving it open for the decision on 96 and 94 branches.

+1 for 0.96 given currently "it is 100% broken". Thanks lads.
Lars, as per ur above comment we can correct the signature in 0.94 also right?

Yes. It is a slight incompatible change (in that somebody who implemented RegionObserver directly will now have to fix their code), but I think we cannot leave it in the broken state.

I'll commit to 0.94 (so that I am responsible if something breaks ).
Want me to commit to 0.96 as well, stack?
Committed to 0.94.

Yes this does not break binary compatibility but breaks src compatibility. If users try recompiling their CP impl with new HBase jar, they MAY have to change. (If they have overridden this method)

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
This fix breaks src compatibility. If users try recompiling their CP impl with new HBase jar, they MAY have to change. (If they have overridden this method)
This does not break binary compatibility
